intro: Donax blumei, commonly known as the Hawaiian fan-palm, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the warm, humid climate of Hawaii. Donax blumei plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various native species.
